sql.description: Analyze tables structure with LLM to check RFC(s) compliance or SQL naming guidelines
sql.sql: SELECT table_schema, table_name FROM information_schema.tables WHERE table_type = 'BASE TABLE' and table_schema not in ('pg_catalog', 'information_schema') ORDER BY table_schema, table_name;

SELECT 
        schemaname || '.' || relname AS table_name,
        n_live_tup AS live_tuples,
        n_dead_tup,
        n_tup_upd ,
        pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(relid)) AS table_size,
        last_vacuum,
        last_autovacuum,
        last_analyze,
        last_autoanalyze,
        CASE 
            WHEN n_dead_tup  + n_tup_upd> 1000 THEN 'VACUUM ANALYZE ' || schemaname || '.' || relname || ';'
            WHEN n_live_tup=0 and last_analyze is null then 'ANALYZE ' || schemaname || '.' || relname || ';'
            WHEN (last_vacuum IS NULL AND last_autovacuum IS null and last_analyze is null) THEN 'VACUUM ANALYZE ' || schemaname || '.' || relname || ';' 
            ELSE '-- NOTHING TO DO'
        END AS pga_suggestion
    FROM 
        pg_stat_user_tables

    ORDER BY 
        n_dead_tup DESC, pg_total_relation_size(relid) DESC;
select name,setting from pg_file_settings;

select category, name, unit, setting from pg_settings where name in ('max_connections','shared_buffers','effective_cache_size','maintenance_work_mem','checkpoint_completion_target','wal_buffers','default_statistics_target','random_page_cost','effective_io_concurrency','work_mem','huge_pages','min_wal_size','max_wal_size','max_worker_processes','max_parallel_workers_per_gather','max_parallel_workers','max_parallel_maintenance_workers','autovacuum') order by name
select pg_size_pretty(pg_database_size('$1'));
SELECT pg_size_pretty(pg_database_size(current_database()));
SELECT round(100.0 * blks_hit / NULLIF(blks_hit+blks_read,0),2) AS ratio FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname = current_database();

SELECT schemaname, relname AS table_name, ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_blks_hit + heap_blks_read, 0), 2) AS table_cache_hit_ratio, ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read, 0), 2) AS index_cache_hit_ratio, CASE WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_blks_hit + heap_blks_read, 0), 2) >= 99 THEN 'Excellent' WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_blks_hit + heap_blks_read, 0), 2) BETWEEN 95 AND 98 THEN 'Good' WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_blks_hit + heap_blks_read, 0), 2) BETWEEN 90 AND 94 THEN 'Average' ELSE 'Poor' END AS table_evaluation, CASE WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read, 0), 2) >= 99 THEN 'Excellent' WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read, 0), 2) BETWEEN 95 AND 98 THEN 'Good' WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read, 0), 2) BETWEEN 90 AND 94 THEN 'Average' ELSE 'Poor' END AS index_evaluation FROM pg_statio_user_tables ORDER BY index_cache_hit_ratio asc, table_cache_hit_ratio asc;

SELECT schemaname, relname AS table_name, n_live_tup AS row_count,  pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(quote_ident(schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(relname))) AS size,  pg_total_relation_size(quote_ident(schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(relname)) AS size_bytes FROM pg_stat_user_tables ORDER BY size_bytes DESC

SELECT schemaname, relname AS table_name, n_live_tup AS row_count,  pg_size_pretty(pg_total_relation_size(quote_ident(schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(relname))) AS size,  pg_total_relation_size(quote_ident(schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(relname)) AS size_bytes FROM pg_stat_user_tables ORDER BY size_bytes DESC LIMIT 5;
SELECT schemaname, relname AS table_name, 'ANALYZE ' || quote_ident(schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(relname) || ';' AS pga_suggestion FROM pg_stat_user_tables ORDER BY schemaname, relname;
SELECT * from pg_statio_user_tables order by heap_blks_read desc;
SELECT pg_user.usename || case when pg_user.usesuper THEN ' (Super user)' else '' end as username FROM pg_catalog.pg_user;
CREATE EXTENSION IF NOT EXISTS pg_stat_statements;
SELECT pg_stat_reset();
SELECT pg_stat_statements_reset();

SELECT 
  query,
  calls,
  rows,
  ROUND(cast(total_exec_time as numeric),2) as total_exec_time,
  ROUND(cast(mean_exec_time as numeric),5) as mean_exec_time,
  ROUND(cast(min_exec_time as numeric),5) as min_exec_time,
  ROUND(cast(max_exec_time as numeric),5) as max_exec_time,
  ROUND(cast(stddev_exec_time as numeric),5) as stddev_exec_time,
  round(shared_blks_hit/(shared_blks_hit+shared_blks_read)::NUMERIC*100,2) as hit_cache_ratio,
   wal_records,
  wal_fpi,
  wal_bytes,
  queryid,
  (shared_blks_read + temp_blks_read + local_blks_read) AS total_blks_read
FROM 
  pg_stat_statements
WHERE 
  shared_blks_hit > 0 
  AND query NOT LIKE '%pg_catalog%' 
  AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'copy%' 
  AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'set%' AND LOWER(query) not like '/* launched by pgassistant */%' 
ORDER BY 
  total_exec_time DESC 
LIMIT 50

SELECT query,calls,ROUND(total_exec_time::numeric,2) AS total_exec_time,ROUND(mean_exec_time::numeric,5) AS mean_exec_time,ROUND(min_exec_time::numeric,5) AS min_exec_time,ROUND(max_exec_time::numeric,5) AS max_exec_time,ROUND(stddev_exec_time::numeric,5) AS stddev_exec_time,ROUND(100*shared_blks_hit::numeric/NULLIF(shared_blks_hit+shared_blks_read,0),2) AS hit_cache_ratio,(shared_blks_read+temp_blks_read+local_blks_read) AS total_blks_read,shared_blk_read_time,shared_blk_write_time,local_blk_read_time,local_blk_write_time,temp_blk_read_time,temp_blk_write_time,rows,plans,ROUND(total_plan_time::numeric,2) AS total_plan_time,ROUND(mean_plan_time::numeric,5) AS mean_plan_time,ROUND(min_plan_time::numeric,5) AS min_plan_time,ROUND(max_plan_time::numeric,5) AS max_plan_time,ROUND(stddev_plan_time::numeric,5) AS stddev_plan_time,wal_records,wal_fpi,wal_bytes,wal_buffers_full,jit_functions,jit_generation_time,jit_inlining_count,jit_inlining_time,jit_optimization_count,jit_optimization_time,jit_emission_count,jit_emission_time,jit_deform_count,jit_deform_time,parallel_workers_to_launch,parallel_workers_launched,queryid,stats_since,minmax_stats_since FROM pg_stat_statements WHERE (shared_blks_hit+shared_blks_read)>0 AND query NOT LIKE '%pg_catalog%' AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'copy%' AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'set%' AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE '/* launched by pgassistant */%' ORDER BY total_exec_time DESC LIMIT 50;

WITH s AS (SELECT schemaname, relname AS table_name, heap_blks_hit, heap_blks_read, idx_blks_hit, idx_blks_read, (heap_blks_hit + heap_blks_read) AS heap_total, (idx_blks_hit + idx_blks_read) AS idx_total FROM pg_statio_user_tables) SELECT schemaname, table_name, ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_total, 0), 2) AS table_cache_hit_ratio, ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_total, 0), 2) AS index_cache_hit_ratio, CASE WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_total, 0), 2) >= 99 THEN 'Excellent' WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_total, 0), 2) BETWEEN 95 AND 98 THEN 'Good' WHEN ROUND(100 * heap_blks_hit / NULLIF(heap_total, 0), 2) BETWEEN 90 AND 94 THEN 'Average' ELSE 'Poor' END AS table_evaluation, CASE WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_total, 0), 2) >= 99 THEN 'Excellent' WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_total, 0), 2) BETWEEN 95 AND 98 THEN 'Good' WHEN ROUND(100 * idx_blks_hit / NULLIF(idx_total, 0), 2) BETWEEN 90 AND 94 THEN 'Average' ELSE 'Poor' END AS index_evaluation FROM s WHERE heap_total > 0 AND idx_total > 0 ORDER BY index_cache_hit_ratio ASC, table_cache_hit_ratio ASC;

WITH ranked_queries AS (SELECT query, queryid, calls, rows, mean_exec_time, total_exec_time, (shared_blks_hit / NULLIF((shared_blks_hit + shared_blks_read), 0)::NUMERIC) * 100 AS hit_cache_ratio, calls * mean_exec_time AS weighted_execution_time, (1 - (shared_blks_hit / NULLIF((shared_blks_hit + shared_blks_read), 0)::NUMERIC)) * 100 AS weighted_hit_cache_ratio FROM pg_stat_statements WHERE query NOT LIKE '%pg_catalog%' AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'copy%' AND LOWER(query) NOT LIKE 'set%' AND calls > 1), normalized_scores AS (SELECT query, queryid, calls, rows, mean_exec_time, total_exec_time, hit_cache_ratio, weighted_execution_time, weighted_hit_cache_ratio, weighted_execution_time / NULLIF(MAX(weighted_execution_time) OVER (), 0) AS normalized_execution_time, weighted_hit_cache_ratio / NULLIF(MAX(weighted_hit_cache_ratio) OVER (), 0) AS normalized_hit_cache_ratio FROM ranked_queries) SELECT query, queryid, calls, rows, mean_exec_time, hit_cache_ratio, total_exec_time, ROUND(CAST(normalized_execution_time * 60 AS NUMERIC), 2) AS execution_time_percentage, ROUND(CAST(normalized_hit_cache_ratio * 40 AS NUMERIC), 2) AS cache_ratio_percentage, ROUND(CAST((normalized_execution_time * 60 + normalized_hit_cache_ratio * 40) AS NUMERIC), 2) AS optimization_score_percentage FROM normalized_scores WHERE (normalized_execution_time IS NOT NULL AND normalized_hit_cache_ratio IS NOT NULL) ORDER BY optimization_score_percentage DESC LIMIT 50;

SELECT schemaname, relname, seq_scan, seq_tup_read / seq_scan AS tup_per_scan,(select query from pg_stat_statements where lower(query) like '%'||relname||'%' and lower(query) not like '%explain analyze%' and lower(query) not like '%pg_catalog%' and lower(query) not like 'copy%' and lower(query) not like 'set%' order by total_exec_time desc limit 1 ), last_seq_scan, seq_tup_read, idx_tup_fetch, last_vacuum, last_autovacuum, last_analyze FROM pg_stat_user_tables WHERE seq_scan > 0 order by seq_scan desc limit 50;

select schemaname, tablename, attname, null_frac, n_distinct,most_common_vals, correlation from pg_stats where schemaname not in ('pg_catalog','information_schema' ) order by schemaname, tablename,attname;

sql.description: TOP 20 Unused indexes (excluding those supporting primary keys, unique constraints ordered by index size)
sql.sql: SELECT a.schemaname,a.relname,a.indexrelname,b.indexdef,pg_relation_size(a.indexrelid) AS index_size_bytes,pg_size_pretty(pg_relation_size(a.indexrelid)) AS index_size_pretty,'DROP INDEX CONCURRENTLY IF EXISTS '||quote_ident(a.schemaname)||'.'||quote_ident(a.indexrelname)||'; ANALYZE '||quote_ident(a.schemaname)||'.'||quote_ident(a.relname)||';' AS pga_suggestion FROM pg_stat_user_indexes a JOIN pg_indexes b ON a.schemaname=b.schemaname AND a.relname=b.tablename AND a.indexrelname=b.indexname JOIN pg_index i ON i.indexrelid=a.indexrelid LEFT JOIN pg_constraint c ON c.conindid=i.indexrelid AND c.contype IN('p','u') WHERE a.idx_scan=0 AND c.oid IS NULL AND NOT i.indisunique AND NOT EXISTS(SELECT 1 FROM pg_constraint fk WHERE fk.contype='f' AND fk.conrelid=a.relid AND (WITH fk_cols AS(SELECT regexp_split_to_array(regexp_replace(fk.conkey::text,'[{}]','','g'),'[,\s]+')::int[] AS cols),idx_cols AS(SELECT regexp_split_to_array(regexp_replace(i.indkey::text,'[{}]','','g'),'[,\s]+')::int[] AS cols) SELECT COALESCE(i.indnkeyatts,i.indnatts)>=cardinality(fk_cols.cols) AND idx_cols.cols[1:cardinality(fk_cols.cols)]=fk_cols.cols FROM fk_cols,idx_cols)) ORDER BY index_size_bytes DESC,a.schemaname,a.relname,a.indexrelname LIMIT 20;
SELECT relname, 100 * idx_scan / (seq_scan + idx_scan) percent_of_times_index_used, n_live_tup FROM pg_stat_user_tables where seq_scan + idx_scan>0 ORDER BY n_live_tup DESC;
SELECT schemaname, relname,indexrelname,idx_blks_read,idx_blks_hit FROM pg_statio_user_indexes order by idx_blks_read desc;
SELECT schemaname, tablename, indexname, indexdef FROM pg_indexes WHERE schemaname != 'pg_catalog' ORDER BY schemaname, tablename, indexname;

WITH fk_indexes AS (
    SELECT 
        n.nspname AS schemaname,
        ci.relname AS index_name,
        cr.relname AS tablename,
        (confrelid::regclass)::text AS fk_table_ref,
        array_to_string(indclass, ', ') AS opclasses
    FROM pg_index i
    JOIN pg_class ci ON ci.oid = i.indexrelid AND ci.relkind = 'i'
    JOIN pg_class cr ON cr.oid = i.indrelid AND cr.relkind = 'r'
    JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = ci.relnamespace
    JOIN pg_constraint cn ON cn.conrelid = cr.oid
    LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_indexes si ON si.indexrelid = i.indexrelid
    WHERE contype = 'f' 
      AND i.indisunique IS FALSE
      AND conkey IS NOT NULL
      AND ci.relpages > 0
      AND si.idx_scan < 10
),
index_data AS (
    SELECT 
        *,
        (SELECT string_agg(lpad(i, 3, '0'), ' ') FROM unnest(string_to_array(indkey::text, ' ')) i) AS columns,
        array_to_string(indclass, ', ') AS opclasses
    FROM pg_index i
    JOIN pg_class ci ON ci.oid = i.indexrelid AND ci.relkind = 'i'
    WHERE indisvalid = TRUE 
      AND ci.relpages > 0
),
redundant_indexes AS (
    SELECT 
        i2.indexrelid AS index_id,
        tnsp.nspname AS schemaname,
        trel.relname AS table_name,
        pg_relation_size(trel.oid) AS table_size_bytes,
        irel.relname AS index_name,
        am1.amname AS access_method,
        (i1.indexrelid::regclass)::text AS reason,
        i1.indexrelid AS reason_index_id,
        pg_get_indexdef(i1.indexrelid) AS main_index_def,
        pg_size_pretty(pg_relation_size(i1.indexrelid)) AS main_index_size,
        pg_get_indexdef(i2.indexrelid) AS index_def,
        pg_relation_size(i2.indexrelid) AS index_size_bytes,
        s.idx_scan AS index_usage,
        quote_ident(tnsp.nspname) AS formated_schema_name,
        COALESCE(NULLIF(quote_ident(tnsp.nspname), 'public') || '.', '') || quote_ident(irel.relname) AS formated_index_name,
        quote_ident(trel.relname) AS formated_table_name,
        COALESCE(NULLIF(quote_ident(tnsp.nspname), 'public') || '.', '') || quote_ident(trel.relname) AS formated_relation_name,
        i2.opclasses
    FROM index_data AS i1
    JOIN index_data AS i2 ON (
        i1.indrelid = i2.indrelid 
        AND i1.indexrelid <> i2.indexrelid
    )
    INNER JOIN pg_opclass op1 ON i1.indclass[0] = op1.oid
    INNER JOIN pg_opclass op2 ON i2.indclass[0] = op2.oid
    INNER JOIN pg_am am1 ON op1.opcmethod = am1.oid
    INNER JOIN pg_am am2 ON op2.opcmethod = am2.oid
    JOIN pg_stat_user_indexes AS s ON s.indexrelid = i2.indexrelid
    JOIN pg_class AS trel ON trel.oid = i2.indrelid
    JOIN pg_namespace AS tnsp ON trel.relnamespace = tnsp.oid
    JOIN pg_class AS irel ON irel.oid = i2.indexrelid
    WHERE NOT i2.indisprimary
      AND NOT (i2.indisunique AND NOT i1.indisprimary)
      AND am1.amname = am2.amname
      AND i1.columns LIKE (i2.columns || '%')
      AND i1.opclasses LIKE (i2.opclasses || '%')
      AND pg_get_expr(i1.indexprs, i1.indrelid) IS NOT DISTINCT FROM pg_get_expr(i2.indexprs, i2.indrelid)
      AND pg_get_expr(i1.indpred, i1.indrelid) IS NOT DISTINCT FROM pg_get_expr(i2.indpred, i2.indrelid)
),
redundant_indexes_fk AS (
    SELECT 
        ri.*, 
        (SELECT COUNT(1) 
         FROM fk_indexes fi 
         WHERE fi.fk_table_ref = ri.table_name 
           AND fi.opclasses LIKE (ri.opclasses || '%')) > 0 AS supports_fk
    FROM redundant_indexes ri
),
redundant_indexes_tmp_num AS (
    SELECT 
        ROW_NUMBER() OVER () num, 
        rig.* 
    FROM redundant_indexes_fk rig 
    ORDER BY index_id
),
redundant_indexes_tmp_cut AS (
    SELECT 
        ri1.*, 
        ri2.num AS r_num 
    FROM redundant_indexes_tmp_num ri1
    LEFT JOIN redundant_indexes_tmp_num ri2 ON ri2.reason_index_id = ri1.index_id 
        AND ri1.reason_index_id = ri2.index_id
    WHERE ri1.num < ri2.num OR ri2.num IS NULL
),
redundant_indexes_cut_grouped AS (
    SELECT 
        DISTINCT(num), 
        * 
    FROM redundant_indexes_tmp_cut 
    ORDER BY index_size_bytes DESC
),
redundant_indexes_grouped AS (
    SELECT 
        DISTINCT(num), 
        * 
    FROM redundant_indexes_tmp_cut 
    ORDER BY index_size_bytes DESC
)
SELECT 
    schemaname,
    table_name,
    table_size_bytes,
    index_name,
    access_method,
    STRING_AGG(DISTINCT reason, ', ') AS redundant_to,
    STRING_AGG(main_index_def, ', ') AS main_index_def,
    STRING_AGG(main_index_size, ', ') AS main_index_size,
    index_def,
    index_size_bytes,
    index_usage,
    supports_fk,
    -- Generate DROP INDEX SQL
    CASE 
        WHEN index_usage < 10 AND NOT supports_fk THEN 
            'DROP INDEX ' || 
            COALESCE(NULLIF(quote_ident(schemaname), 'public') || '.', '') || 
            quote_ident(index_name) || '; ANALYZE ' || schemaname || '.' || table_name || ';' 
        ELSE '-- NO RECOMMANDATION'
    END AS pga_suggestion
FROM 
    redundant_indexes_cut_grouped
GROUP BY 
    index_id, schemaname, table_name, table_size_bytes, index_name, access_method, index_def, index_size_bytes, index_usage, supports_fk
ORDER BY 
    index_size_bytes DESC;
SELECT indrelid::regclass AS tablename,array_agg(indexrelid::regclass) AS Indexes FROM pg_index GROUP BY indrelid ,indkey HAVING COUNT(*) > 1;

sql.description: Datatype on foreign keys are different
sql.sql:
WITH foreign_key_columns AS (
        SELECT
            conname AS fk_name,
            conrelid::regclass AS fk_table,
            confrelid::regclass AS ref_table,
            att2.attname AS fk_column,
            att1.attname AS ref_column,
            n.nspname AS schemaname,
            pg_catalog.format_type(att2.atttypid, att2.atttypmod) AS fk_column_type,
            pg_catalog.format_type(att1.atttypid, att1.atttypmod) AS ref_column_type
        FROM
            pg_constraint c
        INNER JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.connamespace
        INNER JOIN pg_attribute att1
            ON att1.attnum = ANY (c.confkey) AND att1.attrelid = c.confrelid
        INNER JOIN pg_attribute att2
            ON att2.attnum = ANY (c.conkey) AND att2.attrelid = c.conrelid
        WHERE
            c.contype = 'f'
    ),
    mismatched_types AS (
        SELECT
            fk_name,
            schemaname,
            fk_table,
            ref_table,
            fk_column,
            ref_column,
            fk_column_type,
            ref_column_type,
            'ALTER TABLE ' || schemaname || '.' || fk_table || 
            ' ALTER COLUMN ' || fk_column || ' TYPE ' || ref_column_type || 
            ' USING ' || fk_column || '::' || ref_column_type || ';' AS pga_suggestion
        FROM
            foreign_key_columns
        WHERE
            fk_column_type <> ref_column_type
    )
    SELECT
        fk_name AS foreign_key_name,
        schemaname,
        fk_table AS foreign_key_table,
        fk_column AS foreign_key_column,
        ref_table AS referenced_table,
        ref_column AS referenced_column,
        fk_column_type AS foreign_key_column_type,
        ref_column_type AS referenced_column_type,
        pga_suggestion
    FROM
        mismatched_types
    ORDER BY
        schemaname, fk_table, fk_name;

sql.description: Issue - Indexes missing on foreign keys
sql.sql: WITH fks AS ( SELECT c.oid AS fk_oid, n.nspname AS schemaname, c.conrelid::regclass AS tablename, c.conname AS fk_name, c.conkey AS fk_cols, c.confrelid::regclass AS referenced_table FROM pg_constraint c JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.connamespace WHERE c.contype = 'f' ), fkeys_without_indexes AS ( SELECT f.* FROM fks f WHERE NOT EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM pg_index i WHERE i.indrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND i.indisvalid AND i.indisready AND i.indkey[0:array_length(f.fk_cols, 1)-1] = f.fk_cols ) ), referenced_stats AS ( SELECT relid::regclass AS referenced_table, n_live_tup FROM pg_stat_user_tables ), suggested_indexes AS ( SELECT f.schemaname, f.tablename, f.fk_name, f.referenced_table, rs.n_live_tup AS estimated_rows, CASE WHEN rs.n_live_tup IS NULL THEN 'REFERENCED TABLE NOT IN pg_stat_user_tables' WHEN rs.n_live_tup = 0 THEN 'REFERENCED TABLE IS NOT ANALYZED OR EMPTY!' WHEN rs.n_live_tup >= 1000 THEN '❌ INDEX STRONGLY RECOMMENDED' WHEN rs.n_live_tup >= 500 THEN '⚠️ INDEX RECOMMENDED (moderate size)' ELSE '✅ INDEX MISSING BUT REFERENCED TABLE IS SMALL' END AS index_importance, ( SELECT string_agg(quote_ident(a.attname), ', ' ORDER BY u.ord) FROM unnest(f.fk_cols) WITH ORDINALITY AS u(attnum, ord) JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND a.attnum = u.attnum ) AS fk_columns, 'CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY IF NOT EXISTS ' || quote_ident('pga_idx_fk_' || replace(f.tablename::text, '.', '_') || '_' || f.fk_name) || ' ON ' || format('%I.%I', f.schemaname, regexp_replace(f.tablename::text, '^.*\.', '')) || ' (' || ( SELECT string_agg(quote_ident(a.attname), ', ' ORDER BY u.ord) FROM unnest(f.fk_cols) WITH ORDINALITY AS u(attnum, ord) JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND a.attnum = u.attnum ) || '); ANALYZE ' || format('%I.%I', f.schemaname, regexp_replace(f.tablename::text, '^.*\.', '')) || ';' AS pga_suggestion_noexec FROM fkeys_without_indexes f LEFT JOIN referenced_stats rs ON rs.referenced_table = f.referenced_table ) SELECT schemaname, tablename, fk_name, fk_columns, referenced_table, estimated_rows, index_importance, pga_suggestion_noexec FROM suggested_indexes ORDER BY schemaname, tablename, fk_name;

SELECT n.nspname AS table_schema, c.relname AS table_name FROM pg_class AS c JOIN pg_namespace AS n ON n.oid = c.relnamespace LEFT JOIN pg_constraint AS co ON co.conrelid = c.oid AND co.contype = 'p' LEFT JOIN pg_inherits AS ih ON ih.inhrelid = c.oid WHERE c.relkind IN ('r','p') AND n.nspname NOT IN ('pg_catalog','information_schema') AND n.nspname NOT LIKE 'pg_toast%' AND n.nspname NOT LIKE 'pg_temp_%' AND co.oid IS NULL AND ih.inhrelid IS NULL ORDER BY table_schema, table_name;

SELECT table_name, column_name, data_type FROM information_schema.columns a where column_name in (select column_name FROM information_schema.columns b where a.column_name = b.column_name and a.data_type != b.data_type and a.table_name != b.table_name and b.table_schema='public') and a.table_schema='public' ORDER BY column_name, table_name;

SHOW ALL
select category, name, setting from pg_settings where lower(name) like 'archive%' or lower(name) like '%wal%';;
SELECT datname, usename, query, application_name, client_addr, backend_start, state FROM pg_stat_activity where datname!='None' order by state,application_name,backend_start;

sql.description: Database activity grouped by user, application, client address and state
sql.sql: SELECT datname, usename, application_name, client_addr, state, count(*) as nb FROM pg_stat_activity where datname!='None' group by datname, usename, application_name, client_addr, state;
SELECT count(*) as nb FROM pg_stat_activity where datname!='None'
SELECT setting FROM pg_settings WHERE name = 'max_connections';

SELECT client_addr, COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE state = 'active') AS active_connections, COUNT(*) FILTER (WHERE state = 'idle') AS idle_connections, COUNT(*) AS total_connections FROM pg_stat_activity WHERE client_addr IS NOT null GROUP BY client_addr ORDER BY total_connections desc LIMIT 5;
SELECT sum(confl_tablespace+confl_lock+confl_snapshot+confl_bufferpin+confl_deadlock) as nb from pg_stat_database_conflicts;
SELECT datname, usename, query, application_name, client_addr, backend_start, state FROM pg_stat_activity where datname!='None' and state !='idle' order by state,application_name,backend_start;
SELECT *  FROM information_schema.schemata;
SELECT * from pg_stat_database_conflicts;

SELECT ( a.wals::int * b.wal_seg_size::int / 1024 / 1024 ) AS WAL_Space_Used_MB FROM (SELECT count(*) wals FROM   pg_ls_dir('pg_wal') WHERE  pg_ls_dir ~ '^[0-9A-F]{24}') a,( SELECT  setting wal_seg_size FROM pg_settings WHERE   name = 'wal_segment_size') b;
SELECT now() wal_capture_time, wal_records, wal_fpi, wal_bytes, wal_buffers_full, wal_write, wal_write_time, wal_sync_time,stats_reset FROM pg_stat_wal;
select column_name, data_type, character_maximum_length, column_default, is_nullable from INFORMATION_SCHEMA.COLUMNS where table_name = '$1';

select queryid, query, calls, rows, total_exec_time,mean_exec_time,min_exec_time,max_exec_time,stddev_exec_time,shared_blks_hit,shared_blks_read,shared_blks_written,shared_blks_dirtied,local_blks_hit,local_blks_read,local_blks_dirtied,temp_blks_read,temp_blks_written,wal_records,wal_fpi,wal_bytes   from pg_stat_statements where query not like '%pg_catalog%' and lower(query) not like 'copy%' and lower(query) not like 'set%' and lower (query) like '%$1%' and lower(query) NOT LIKE '/* launched by pgassistant */%'order by total_exec_time desc limit 50

sql.description: Get sql query by querid in pg_stat_statements
sql.sql: select query from pg_stat_statements where queryid=$1

sql.description: DB Profile : amount of select, insert, update or delete
sql.sql: WITH query_stats AS ( SELECT CASE WHEN lower(query) LIKE '%select %' THEN 'select' WHEN lower(query) LIKE '%insert %' THEN 'insert' WHEN lower(query) LIKE '%update %' THEN 'update' WHEN lower(query) LIKE '%delete %' THEN 'delete' END AS query_type, SUM(calls) AS total_calls, SUM(rows) AS total_rows, SUM(total_exec_time) AS total_exec_time, AVG(mean_exec_time) AS avg_mean_exec_time FROM pg_stat_statements WHERE lower(query) LIKE '%select %' OR lower(query) LIKE '%insert %' OR lower(query) LIKE '%update %' OR lower(query) LIKE '%delete %' GROUP BY query_type ), total_stats AS ( SELECT SUM(total_calls) AS grand_total_calls, SUM(total_exec_time) AS grand_total_exec_time FROM query_stats ) SELECT qs.query_type, qs.total_calls, qs.total_rows, round(qs.total_exec_time::numeric,2) as total_exec_time, round(qs.avg_mean_exec_time::numeric,3) as avg_mean_exec_time, round((qs.total_calls / ts.grand_total_calls) * 100,0) AS percentage_calls, round((qs.total_exec_time / ts.grand_total_exec_time)::numeric * 100,0) AS percentage_exec_time FROM query_stats qs, total_stats ts;
SELECT datname, blks_read, blks_hit, round(100.0 * blks_hit / NULLIF(blks_hit+blks_read,0),2) AS cache_hit, temp_bytes, deadlocks FROM pg_stat_database WHERE datname = current_database();

sql.description: Unused indexes (excluding those supporting primary keys, unique constraints)
sql.sql: SELECT a.schemaname, a.relname, a.indexrelname, b.indexdef, '/* ' || CASE WHEN fk.conname IS NOT NULL THEN 'index used for a foreign key: ' || fk.conname ELSE 'not used for a foreign key' END || ' */ ' || 'DROP INDEX CONCURRENTLY IF EXISTS ' || quote_ident(a.schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(a.indexrelname) || '; ANALYZE ' || quote_ident(a.schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(a.relname) || ';' AS pga_suggestion FROM pg_stat_user_indexes a JOIN pg_indexes b ON a.schemaname=b.schemaname AND a.relname=b.tablename AND a.indexrelname=b.indexname JOIN pg_index i ON i.indexrelid=a.indexrelid LEFT JOIN LATERAL (SELECT conname FROM pg_constraint c WHERE c.contype='f' AND c.conrelid=a.relid AND i.indkey::smallint[]=c.conkey) fk ON TRUE LEFT JOIN pg_constraint c ON c.conindid=i.indexrelid AND c.contype IN ('p','u') WHERE a.idx_scan=0 AND c.oid IS NULL AND NOT i.indisunique ORDER BY a.relname, a.indexrelname;

sql.description: Top 10 queries by total execution time (excluding pgAssistant queries, with cache hit ratio)
sql.sql: SELECT query, calls, total_exec_time, mean_exec_time, rows, shared_blks_hit, shared_blks_read, ROUND(100 * shared_blks_hit / NULLIF(shared_blks_hit + shared_blks_read, 0), 2) AS hit_cache_ratio FROM pg_stat_statements WHERE query NOT LIKE '/* launched by pgAssistant */%' ORDER BY total_exec_time DESC LIMIT 10;

sql.description: Top 10 queries by mean execution time (excluding pgAssistant queries, with cache hit ratio)
sql.sql: SELECT query, calls, total_exec_time, mean_exec_time, rows, shared_blks_hit, shared_blks_read, ROUND(100 * shared_blks_hit / NULLIF(shared_blks_hit + shared_blks_read, 0), 2) AS hit_cache_ratio FROM pg_stat_statements WHERE query NOT LIKE '/* launched by pgAssistant */%' ORDER BY mean_exec_time DESC LIMIT 10;
SELECT schemaname, relname, n_dead_tup, vacuum_count, autovacuum_count,last_vacuum, last_autovacuum, last_analyze, last_autoanalyze FROM pg_stat_user_tables ORDER BY n_dead_tup DESC;

sql.description: Database main parameters from pgTune estimation
sql.sql: SELECT category, name, unit, setting, CASE WHEN unit IN ('8kB','kB','MB','GB') THEN pg_size_pretty(setting::bigint * CASE unit WHEN '8kB' THEN 8192 WHEN 'kB' THEN 1024 WHEN 'MB' THEN 1048576 WHEN 'GB' THEN 1073741824 END) ELSE setting END AS human_readable FROM pg_settings WHERE name IN ('max_connections','shared_buffers','effective_cache_size','maintenance_work_mem','checkpoint_completion_target','wal_buffers','default_statistics_target','random_page_cost','effective_io_concurrency','work_mem','huge_pages','min_wal_size','max_wal_size','max_worker_processes','max_parallel_workers_per_gather','max_parallel_workers','max_parallel_maintenance_workers','autovacuum') ORDER BY name;

WITH diff AS (SELECT now() - pg_postmaster_start_time() AS i) SELECT pg_postmaster_start_time(), now() - pg_postmaster_start_time() AS uptime_interval, round(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (now() - pg_postmaster_start_time())) / 86400, 2) AS uptime_days, trim(both ', ' from concat_ws(', ', CASE WHEN extract(month FROM i)::int > 0 THEN extract(month FROM i)::int || ' months' END, CASE WHEN extract(day FROM i)::int > 0 THEN extract(day FROM i)::int || ' days' END, CASE WHEN extract(hour FROM i)::int > 0 THEN extract(hour FROM i)::int || ' hours' END, CASE WHEN extract(minute FROM i)::int > 0 THEN extract(minute FROM i)::int || ' minutes' END)) AS uptime_pretty FROM diff;

sql.description: Database profile: amount of select, insert, update or delete
sql.sql: WITH head AS (SELECT queryid, calls, rows, total_exec_time, mean_exec_time, lower(substring(query FROM '(?is)^\s*(?:/\*.*?\*/\s*)*(?:--[^\n]*\n\s*)*(\w+)')) AS first_token FROM pg_stat_statements), classified AS (SELECT queryid, calls, rows, total_exec_time::numeric AS total_exec_time, mean_exec_time::numeric AS avg_mean_exec_time, CASE WHEN first_token IN ('select','insert','update','delete') THEN first_token WHEN first_token = 'with' THEN 'select' WHEN first_token IN ('merge') THEN 'merge' WHEN first_token IN ('call') THEN 'call' WHEN first_token IN ('create','alter','drop','truncate','comment','grant','revoke','rename') THEN 'ddl' WHEN first_token IN ('copy','analyze','vacuum','explain','show','set','reset','discard','checkpoint','prepare','execute','deallocate','listen','unlisten','notify','begin','start','commit','rollback','savepoint','release') THEN 'utility' ELSE 'other' END AS query_type FROM head), agg AS (SELECT query_type, SUM(calls) AS total_calls, SUM(rows) AS total_rows, SUM(total_exec_time) AS total_exec_time, AVG(avg_mean_exec_time) AS avg_mean_exec_time FROM classified GROUP BY query_type), tot AS (SELECT SUM(total_calls)::numeric AS grand_total_calls, SUM(total_exec_time)::numeric AS grand_total_exec_time FROM agg) SELECT a.query_type, a.total_calls, a.total_rows, ROUND(a.total_exec_time, 2) AS total_exec_time, ROUND(a.avg_mean_exec_time, 3) AS avg_mean_exec_time, COALESCE(ROUND(100.0 * a.total_calls::numeric / NULLIF(t.grand_total_calls, 0), 0), 0)::int AS percentage_calls, COALESCE(ROUND(100.0 * a.total_exec_time / NULLIF(t.grand_total_exec_time, 0), 0), 0)::int AS percentage_exec_time FROM agg a CROSS JOIN tot t ORDER BY percentage_exec_time DESC NULLS LAST, percentage_calls DESC NULLS LAST;

SELECT cp.num_timed AS checkpoints_timed, cp.num_requested AS checkpoints_req, (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) AS checkpoints_total, CASE WHEN (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 0 THEN round((cp.num_requested::numeric * 100.0::numeric) / (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested), 1) ELSE NULL END AS checkpoints_req_ratio_pct, cp.write_time AS checkpoint_write_time, cp.sync_time AS checkpoint_sync_time, CASE WHEN (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 0 THEN round(((cp.write_time + cp.sync_time)::numeric / (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested)), 1) ELSE NULL END AS avg_checkpoint_time_ms, cp.buffers_written AS buffers_checkpoint, bg.buffers_clean, bg.maxwritten_clean, bg.buffers_alloc, cp.stats_reset AS stats_reset_checkpointer, bg.stats_reset AS stats_reset_bgwriter, (CASE WHEN (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 0 AND (cp.write_time + cp.sync_time) / (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 5000 THEN '🔴 ' WHEN cp.num_requested > cp.num_timed OR bg.maxwritten_clean > 0 THEN '🟠 ' ELSE '🟢 ' END || CASE WHEN cp.num_requested > cp.num_timed THEN 'High number of WAL-driven checkpoints (num_requested > num_timed): consider increasing max_wal_size.' ELSE 'Checkpoints are mostly time-driven: max_wal_size seems adequate.' END || CASE WHEN (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 0 AND (cp.write_time + cp.sync_time) / (cp.num_timed + cp.num_requested) > 5000 THEN ' Average checkpoint time is high (> 5000 ms): check I/O performance and checkpoint_completion_target and storage performance.' ELSE '' END || CASE WHEN bg.maxwritten_clean > 0 THEN ' Background writer frequently reaches its write limit (maxwritten_clean > 0): consider tuning bgwriter_lru_maxpages and bgwriter_lru_multiplier.' ELSE '' END) AS pga_suggestion_bgwriter FROM pg_stat_bgwriter AS bg CROSS JOIN pg_stat_checkpointer AS cp;

SELECT checkpoints_timed, checkpoints_req, (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) AS checkpoints_total, CASE WHEN (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 0 THEN round((checkpoints_req::numeric * 100.0::numeric) / (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req), 1) ELSE NULL END AS checkpoints_req_ratio_pct, checkpoint_write_time, checkpoint_sync_time, CASE WHEN (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 0 THEN round(((checkpoint_write_time + checkpoint_sync_time)::numeric / (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req)), 1) ELSE NULL END AS avg_checkpoint_time_ms, buffers_checkpoint, buffers_clean, buffers_backend, buffers_backend_fsync, maxwritten_clean, buffers_alloc, stats_reset, (CASE WHEN buffers_backend_fsync > 0 OR ((checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 0 AND (checkpoint_write_time + checkpoint_sync_time) / (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 5000) THEN '🔴 ' WHEN checkpoints_req > checkpoints_timed OR maxwritten_clean > 0 THEN '🟠 ' ELSE '🟢 ' END || (CASE WHEN checkpoints_req > checkpoints_timed THEN 'High number of WAL-driven checkpoints (checkpoints_req > checkpoints_timed): consider increasing max_wal_size.' ELSE 'Checkpoints are mostly time-driven: max_wal_size seems adequate.' END || CASE WHEN (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 0 AND (checkpoint_write_time + checkpoint_sync_time) / (checkpoints_timed + checkpoints_req) > 5000 THEN ' Average checkpoint time is high (> 5000 ms): check I/O performance and checkpoint_completion_target.' ELSE '' END || CASE WHEN buffers_backend_fsync > 0 THEN ' Backends had to perform fsync (buffers_backend_fsync > 0): checkpointer may be overloaded or I/O is too slow.' ELSE '' END || CASE WHEN maxwritten_clean > 0 THEN ' Background writer frequently reaches its write limit (maxwritten_clean > 0): consider tuning bgwriter_lru_maxpages and bgwriter_lru_multiplier.' ELSE '' END)) AS pga_suggestion_bgwriter FROM pg_stat_bgwriter;
SELECT current_setting('shared_buffers');

sql.description: Issue & action - Usefull Indexes missing on foreign keys
sql.sql: WITH fks AS ( SELECT c.oid AS fk_oid, n.nspname AS schemaname, c.conrelid::regclass AS tablename, c.conname AS fk_name, c.conkey AS fk_cols, c.confrelid::regclass AS referenced_table FROM pg_constraint c JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = c.connamespace WHERE c.contype = 'f' ), fkeys_without_indexes AS ( SELECT f.* FROM fks f WHERE NOT EXISTS ( SELECT 1 FROM pg_index i WHERE i.indrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND i.indisvalid AND i.indisready AND i.indkey[0:array_length(f.fk_cols, 1)-1] = f.fk_cols ) ), referenced_stats AS ( SELECT relid::regclass AS referenced_table, n_live_tup FROM pg_stat_user_tables ), suggested_indexes AS ( SELECT f.schemaname, f.tablename, f.fk_name, f.referenced_table, rs.n_live_tup AS estimated_rows, CASE WHEN rs.n_live_tup IS NULL THEN 'REFERENCED TABLE NOT IN pg_stat_user_tables' WHEN rs.n_live_tup = 0 THEN 'REFERENCED TABLE IS NOT ANALYZED OR EMPTY!' WHEN rs.n_live_tup >= 1000 THEN '❌ INDEX STRONGLY RECOMMENDED' WHEN rs.n_live_tup >= 500 THEN '⚠️ INDEX RECOMMENDED (moderate size)' ELSE '✅ INDEX MISSING BUT REFERENCED TABLE IS SMALL' END AS index_importance, ( SELECT string_agg(quote_ident(a.attname), ', ' ORDER BY u.ord) FROM unnest(f.fk_cols) WITH ORDINALITY AS u(attnum, ord) JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND a.attnum = u.attnum ) AS fk_columns, 'CREATE INDEX CONCURRENTLY IF NOT EXISTS ' || quote_ident('pga_idx_fk_' || replace(f.tablename::text, '.', '_') || '_' || f.fk_name) || ' ON ' || format('%I.%I', f.schemaname, regexp_replace(f.tablename::text, '^.*\.', '')) || ' (' || ( SELECT string_agg(quote_ident(a.attname), ', ' ORDER BY u.ord) FROM unnest(f.fk_cols) WITH ORDINALITY AS u(attnum, ord) JOIN pg_attribute a ON a.attrelid = f.tablename::regclass AND a.attnum = u.attnum ) || '); ANALYZE ' || format('%I.%I', f.schemaname, regexp_replace(f.tablename::text, '^.*\.', '')) || ';' AS pga_suggestion_noexec FROM fkeys_without_indexes f LEFT JOIN referenced_stats rs ON rs.referenced_table = f.referenced_table ) SELECT schemaname, tablename, fk_name, fk_columns, referenced_table, estimated_rows, index_importance, pga_suggestion_noexec FROM suggested_indexes ORDER BY schemaname, tablename, fk_name;

sql.description: Issue & action - Remove duplicate indexes (with strict definition match)
sql.sql: WITH index_data AS (SELECT i.indexrelid, n.nspname AS schemaname, t.relname AS table_name, c.relname AS index_name, t.oid AS table_oid, pg_relation_size(i.indexrelid) AS index_size_bytes, COALESCE(s.idx_scan, 0) AS index_usage, pg_get_indexdef(i.indexrelid) AS index_def, i.indisprimary, i.indisunique, EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM pg_constraint con WHERE con.conindid = i.indexrelid) AS is_constraint_index, format('%s|%s|%s|%s|%s|%s|%s', i.indrelid, i.indkey, i.indclass, i.indoption, pg_get_expr(i.indexprs, i.indrelid), pg_get_expr(i.indpred, i.indrelid), am.amname) AS index_signature FROM pg_index i JOIN pg_class c ON c.oid = i.indexrelid AND c.relkind = 'i' JOIN pg_class t ON t.oid = i.indrelid AND t.relkind = 'r' JOIN pg_namespace n ON n.oid = t.relnamespace JOIN pg_am am ON am.oid = c.relam LEFT JOIN pg_stat_user_indexes s ON s.indexrelid = i.indexrelid WHERE i.indisvalid), duplicate_defs AS (SELECT index_signature, COALESCE(MIN(indexrelid) FILTER (WHERE is_constraint_index OR indisunique), MIN(indexrelid)) AS keeper_index_id, COUNT(*) AS cnt FROM index_data GROUP BY index_signature HAVING COUNT(*) > 1) SELECT d.schemaname, d.table_name, d.index_name, d.index_def, d.index_size_bytes, d.index_usage, 'DROP INDEX ' || quote_ident(d.schemaname) || '.' || quote_ident(d.index_name) || ';' AS pga_action FROM index_data d JOIN duplicate_defs dd ON d.index_signature = dd.index_signature AND d.indexrelid <> dd.keeper_index_id AND d.is_constraint_index = FALSE AND d.indisunique = FALSE ORDER BY d.index_size_bytes DESC;

sql.description: Tables that need to be analyzed
sql.sql: WITH t AS (SELECT schemaname,relname,relid,n_live_tup,n_dead_tup,n_mod_since_analyze,last_analyze,last_autoanalyze,pg_total_relation_size(relid) AS table_size_bytes,GREATEST(last_analyze,last_autoanalyze) AS last_any_analyze FROM pg_stat_user_tables),x AS (SELECT *, (n_mod_since_analyze::numeric/NULLIF(n_live_tup,0)) AS churn_ratio,EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (now()-last_any_analyze))/86400.0 AS stats_age_days FROM t),scored AS (SELECT schemaname,relname,table_size_bytes,pg_size_pretty(table_size_bytes) AS table_size_pretty,n_live_tup,n_dead_tup,n_mod_since_analyze,ROUND(churn_ratio*100,2) AS churn_pct,last_analyze,last_autoanalyze,ROUND(stats_age_days,1) AS stats_age_days,CASE WHEN last_any_analyze IS NULL THEN 'HIGH' WHEN table_size_bytes>=1024*1024*1024 AND (stats_age_days>14 OR churn_ratio>0.20) THEN 'HIGH' WHEN stats_age_days>30 OR churn_ratio>0.30 THEN 'MEDIUM' ELSE 'NONE' END AS pga_recommendation_level,CASE WHEN last_any_analyze IS NULL THEN 'Table has never been analyzed' WHEN table_size_bytes>=1024*1024*1024 AND stats_age_days>14 THEN 'Large table with outdated statistics' WHEN table_size_bytes>=1024*1024*1024 AND churn_ratio>0.20 THEN 'Large table with significant data churn since last analyze' WHEN stats_age_days>30 THEN 'Statistics are older than 30 days' WHEN churn_ratio>0.30 THEN 'High proportion of data modified since last analyze' ELSE 'Statistics require attention' END AS pga_recommendation_comment FROM x) SELECT *,'ANALYZE '||quote_ident(schemaname)||'.'||quote_ident(relname)||';' AS pga_suggestion FROM scored WHERE pga_recommendation_level IN ('HIGH','MEDIUM') ORDER BY CASE pga_recommendation_level WHEN 'HIGH' THEN 2 WHEN 'MEDIUM' THEN 1 END DESC,table_size_bytes DESC,schemaname,relname;
